title: Record the use of --explicit in a run record
body:
In today's labmeeting we agreed to tackle UX issues more heavily. In an attempt to fix #5547, this PR records the use of ``--explicit`` in a run record.
In an attempt to start a conversation about how to handle the presence of ``explicit = true`` records during rerun, the second commit in this PR also (in a quite encroaching manner) lets the original ``--explicit`` flag "override" a non-set ``--explicit`` flag in a rerun. The second commit is not sufficient, because it completely lacks critical thoughts or solutions on what @kyleam noted in the original issue:

> At least one thing that would need to be carefully thought through is the interaction between rerunning explicit and non-explicit commits. For example, if rerun first processes an explicit=True commit followed by an explict=False one, rerunning without any further checks will result in that commit absorbing unrelated changes.

I secretly hope that someone is so offended by this bad commit that it starts a conversation on how to handle this. I couldn't come up with a solution, but maybe someone else has a good idea. At the very least, with the first commit ``--explicit`` is recorded, even if we decide to not yet act on it.
